description: Two hooded figures, one carrying a lit candle, cautiously enter a room, appearing fearful. They discover a cat sitting on a table, looking back at them, while a potted plant lies overturned on the floor below. The irony lies in the figures, who resemble death or spirits, being relieved and thankful that the source of a disturbance was merely a cat, implying their fear was directed at something ordinary rather than the potentially supernatural or dangerous. Their appearance contrasts sharply with their vulnerability and mundane fear. The scene presents an absurd reversal of expectations, where intimidating entities are startled by a common household pet.
caption: "Thank God! ... It was only a cat!"
